title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Bio or Physical Science Stream
description: A strong foundation in science is essential. The Biological Science stream is ideal, but the Physical Science stream is also a viable entry path for a university degree.

title: Bachelor's Degree in Environmental Science/Management
description: Complete a 3-4 year BSc degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Management, or a related field like Forestry, Fisheries, or Natural Resources.
qualifications: BSc in Environmental Science or a related field

title: Gain Field Experience & Master's Degree
description: Work in an entry-level role as a Research Assistant or a Project Assistant for an environmental NGO or a research institution. A Master's degree (MSc) is often necessary to advance to a full scientist role, allowing for specialization.

title: Environmental Scientist / Consultant
description: Work as a scientist for a government agency, a private consultancy firm, or an NGO. Your work could involve conducting EIAs for development projects, monitoring pollution levels, or managing conservation projects.
qualifications: Proven track record in research or consultancy

title: Senior Scientist / Policy Advisor
description: Advance to a senior role, leading research teams or managing large-scale environmental projects. With a PhD and extensive experience, you can influence national environmental policy, working for government bodies or international organizations like the UNDP or World Bank.
qualifications: PhD in a specialized environmental field
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and further education
